Reviews.Content: I needed a backup for my 5d Mark 2 and considered another 5dm2 a 5dc 5 7d and the 60d. After reading many reviews and seen some samples online I finally decided on the 60d.After exactly 6 month now I can said it was a good choice. While all the other are great camera as well the features and price of the 60d are a great value. I haven't use it for video just stills and it just a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Coming full circle
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I started out with a 40D. That was my first "real camera". Before then, I was using a then-new Canon G7 and thought that I was pretty hip for having a better-than-average camera. The 40D started me on the DSLR path and it's been thoroughly enjoyable so far. I went into the hobby hard core and pretty much have owned every body since the original Rebel XT all the way to the 5D MKII. At the height of my insanity, I had several pelican cases full of camera gear. About six months ago, I decided that I've explored the Canon system enough to my satisfaction, and that I would now distill down to at most two bodies and 5-6 lenses. I sold off everything, including the 5D MKII and now have a very old XTi that I don't care about banging up, and this 60D for when I want to make more of an effort.Plenty of other people have posted their impressions of the 60D, including some very technical reviews. I will just say that after giving this hobby a serious go in terms of time and money, after doing 3 years of paid gigs on the side of product photography, this the 60D takes better pictures than my abilities. The XTi also probably takes better photos than my abilities. It's a great body, easy to use, good quality, and dependable. I really like it and have now come full circle for the 40D that I first bought.

Reviews.Title: Canon 60D worth the wait.
Reviews.Author: lmrson
Reviews.Content: OOOOOh so happy with my purchase of this camera and lens.  I waited 3 years to save the money and not have to spend it elsewhere.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: OneManThinkTank
Reviews.Content: Having shot with various Canon DSLRs over the years, this is my favorite.  The screen is great, and I really miss that flip and swivel screen when I'm shooting on something without it.  Great video capability and easy controls.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: George Sumrall
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay and even with that thrown aside this is one of the best dslrs you can get. If you are into sport photography or are a videographer the 1080p HD recording capability with both 24p and 30 are worth the money. Boasting a 18 mp sensor (same as t2i up to 7D) this camera with flip open and rotating LCD screen are fantastic. The ability to shoot at 5.3 fps and with a shutter speed of 1/8000 to 30" is impressive for the price. Very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, great value
Reviews.Author: I Buy Stuff "I Buy Stuff"
Reviews.Content: I recently upgraded from my Canon 350D Rebel XT to the Canon 60D.  I love Canon DSLR's and lenses and have been using them for six years and counting.  If you are looking for something that delivers a lot of "bang for you buck," this is a great camera for semi-pro and professionals alike.  The camera body is only half the battle when it comes to making successful images.  If the 7D, the next step up, is too steep in price, the 60D's price point allows the photographer to invest in the other half of making successful images, investing in high-quality lenses.  I love that about this camera - it gives me room to grow my lens collection which is what truly makes a huge difference in the quality of your images.  The rest is up to you - take classes and practice like crazy to understand the nature of light - it's at the heart of every image.  If you are not a photographer (or studying to become one) and just want a DSLR to capture family events and such, I would definitely stick with the more affordable Canon T1 series.  The detailed reviews of the 60D speak for themselves and if you wind up disappointed with it, I'd gamble you just didn't do enough research to get the right camera that meets your individual photographic needs and wants.

Reviews.Title: A great all around camera
Reviews.Author: MAW
Reviews.Content: I've been using my 60D for wildlife and astro imaging for over 1 year - in temperatures as low as 35 degrees (using an AC adapter for astro imaging).  I am extremely pleased with its performance and find the articulating screen a joy to use.  It's not quite as robust as my 40D, but has superior image quality, allowing me to get the best out of my lenses and telescopes - the 4.3 micron pixels are invaluable in obtaining the sharpest photographs.  I have absolutely no complaints about how the camera performs - for conventional photography.  For video, it uses MOV files which I find to be cumbersome at best.  Since I rarely shoot video it has not been too much of a problem.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: 60D
Reviews.Author: Semper Fortis 1117
Reviews.Content: i have seen some stuff on here complaining about the video of the 60D or the photo in my opinion maybe u are just to much of a beginner or need to find out how to use it.the camera is amazing i use it mostly for cinematography and time lapses and it more than gets the job doneto compare to a nikon at the same price would be a waste of my time because a D7000 doesn't match it and is more expensivei have used a 7D a lot i think they are pretty equal in most areas the things that make the 7D better have no purpose to me i would take the flip out screen for better angles over a magnesium body i like the 7D but not worth 500 more dollars to me.i don't care for the specs this is hands down a great camera that has tons of potential.

Reviews.Title: Compact version of the 7D, and neck and neck with D7000
Reviews.Author: NCHammer
Reviews.Content: This camera is a smaller version of the 7D and competes very well against the newer Nikon D7000.The material is polycarbonate, which is cheaper but strong enough and lighter than metal. Ergonomics is very good, if you get used to relying on right hand to control almost everything. Performance is snappy, instant lock on under most cases, with 9 AF points being cross type. Battery is identical to the one used in 7D and the 5D Mark II, translating to excellent life. Image quality is very high, slightly "darker" than the T2i. Low light / ISO performance is nearly as good as my Nikon D7000, and considering it is $300 cheaper, this is a great camera. I don't use the flip screen for video, but I do use it for instant feedback when I take pictures of myself using a remote and a tripod - very handy. Depending on your perspective, this screen can be a liability since it is not as sturdy as a flat/fixed screen.Kit lens (18-200mm) is capable but is not very strongly built. My copy has focus hunting issues.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR
Reviews.Author: Adam Crawford
Reviews.Content: After many years of doing as much as I could with my point and shoot I finally decided to take the DSLR plunge.  I am happy I did.Firstly, I bought canon as I have owned other canon products and have been happy with them.  My brother has a Canon 7D, which also influence my decision on brand.  After reading extensively on all the types of Canon DSLR's I decided on this one.  It was a toss up between this and some of the high end digital rebels.  I'll let you find online reviews for figure out the difference between the cameras.Great solid construction.  Kit lens 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS UD.  Glad I didn't go with the 18-55.  I've really enjoyed having the extra zoom.  If I had it to do over again I might even give consideration to the kit with an 18-200mm lens.  I bought a 50mm f1.4 prime lens separately.  I knew I would want it for some low light and portiat photography I've been wanting to do.Anyway.  I've really enjoyed the camera.  Been doing some timelapse/long exposure/star trails/trick photography after reading the many online tutorials and it has been a blast.I wish there was a built in intervalometer.  Hopefully canon is working on this and I bet in a year or two it will be standard in even mid-range DSLR's.  Didn't really know this would be a function I would use as I didn't know I was going to be enjoying timelapse photography.  If timelapse really interests you that might be something you would want in a camera.  However, I found a really good/cheap intervalometer on an un-named auction site and I have no limitations in that department.  I guess there is a software intervalometer on the canon disc that comes with the camera; if you want to do that you just have to tether it to your laptop/desktop.

Reviews.Title: Mature and reliable DSLR camera
Reviews.Author: Domagoj
Reviews.Content: As former owner of 450D camera, I have to say that 60D has corrected many of that camera's annoyances, including much better evaluative metering outside in the sun or in more tricky situations (60d though in rare circumstances tends to underexpose indoors, when flash is not used, but there are another metering modes that easily correct this - you can change them fast on top of the camera). Further, jpegs are much better, they are sharp out of the camera, AF is (opposite to my sample of 450D) very accurate, colors are more realistic to those in real life, they are not dull (you can see much difference between various jpeg modes - landscape and neutral for example). 18MP gives very high resolution and detail, same as 1DX pro camera from Canon, for example. Video is also of high quality, handling is excellent, much better than old 450D. High ISO pictures are much cleaner than past xxD (or xxD cameras up to 500d) and you can go up to 3200 ISO for jpeg or to 6400 ISO when post-processing RAW images. There are some new features that are very convenient and useful, like wireless flash control built-in (even cheapest cameras from Canon nowadays have this feature, unlike in the past) or tilt & swivel lcd monitor. Now, you can buy good and powerful Canon-compatible wireless TTL flash (chinese made) for only 150$ and you can immediately start with wireless TTL flash photography with this camera - for this price this was unthinkable years ago. So you have to have that in mind when you think about buying older xxD model instead of this one (you lose great video capability, too). My only complaint about this camera is that LCD is not very color-accurate, i.e. tends to oversaturate reds, but this is perceivable only is specific indoor situations. On color-accurate desktop LCD everything is fine. You can always shoot RAW and post-process easily those pictures, ofcourse. That is an old Achilles' heel of cameras, but new pro cameras (like new Nikon D4 or probably 1dX too) are going to fix that and provide accurate colors and greater color range on camera's lcds, too. Also, I'm still waiting for one-click 100% zoom into the picture in Canon cameras. This can really save some time when reviewing picture's AF point sharpness on camera. Although dynamic range is good enough for most situations, i expect Canon to catch up to Sony here and provide even better sensors in future, so images' post-processing would require less time.In short, this camera is excellent and mature semi-pro DSLR camera. In times when you can have much more compact camera than this one, with virtually same image quality (Sony NEX series)you have to offer something on top of that. Excellent handling, optical quality of accompanying lenses, wide choice of excellent Canons' or third-party flashes, battery grips.. are very important for profesionals or semipros. But for majority of people (and even for pros as second or vacation camera), future (i would even say nowadays actuality) are interchangeable lens compacts. They are much cheaper to have too, especially when you count in much cheaper (although weaker) lenses.

Reviews.Title: Love Love
Reviews.Author: Nessa
Reviews.Content: I am glad my husband went with the upgrade from the Rebels to this camera.  Great view finder, and the control layout is intuitive.  I couldn't be more happy.

Reviews.Title: great camera but focus is slower than expected
Reviews.Author: Joey H
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to start using this camera I bought it with a zoom lens. I found out that if the subject for the picture you are focusing on is big, it will focus pretty quickly but if the subject is small, it searches for a couple of seconds or wont focus at all..then I have to manually focus. I thought that it might be the lens that causes this problems but I tried different lenses, the camera still act the same. Everything else seem to be working fine. I am happy with my purchase for now, hope when I start using it a little more, I will be happier. I rated at 4 stars because of this focusing problems. I am a non-pro user and love to take picture as a hobby. I hope this review help some of you because I also rely on review like this to make my final decision.

Reviews.Title: What a step up
Reviews.Author: DesignDawg
Reviews.Content: I was first introduced to the DSLR with the Rebel XS a few years ago, and after having lost that camera, I went the past 18 months or so without a DSLR.  I have been a little disappointed with the "hole" in my digital photos where I've only used point and shoot cameras (and my phone) to take pictures of my 2 kids (4 and 7).  I researched for months and was pretty well focused on the T3i most of that time, until I saw a video rundown that convinced me that the 60D is worth leapfrogging the T3i. For just a little more money, you get a respectable amount more camera.  I have since spent a little time with a T3i, and I am very glad I went with the 60D.  Most of all, though, in comparison to the old Rebel I had, it feels like I've graduated to a "big boy" camera.  It is larger, fits in the hand much more comfortably, and the dial on the back (vs. the Rebel line's 4-way buttons) is not to be underestimated.  Also, the video on this thing...wow.I can't wait to buy "gifts" for this camera (new lenses) and watch my photography improve.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: R. Paterson III "Trey P."
Reviews.Content: The Canon 60D with the 18-135mm zoom lens. The lens has enough versatility that it hasn't been a problem that I haven't been able to afford any more lenses yet. So far a joy to use, Taking fine photos, and beautiful HD video. I bought it primarily for it's video function and am currently using it for the production of two movie projects. It is easy to use if you're familiar with SLR or DSLR cameras. Used to be an ardent Nikon man until I found this camera and I personally love it.

Reviews.Title: Camera that is worth the money
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: You put this camera in your hand and you know you are holding a quality product.  Takes great pictures and is capable of most adjustments if you know what to adjust.  We prefer the auto mode which takes care of the hassle but many settings are available if desired.  Especially like the large LCD panel that can be rotated if desired.  To get maximum benefit out of this camera I recommend reading the manual from front to cover.  This can be a simple point and shot camera but if you want to achieve the maximum potential you definately need to become familiar with all aspects of its capability.  This is not a small camera but fills the hand when holding it and it does have a solid but not heavy feel.  Also the menus are very easy to read and understand.  Very user friendly.  Very impressed so far.  The wife and I are not professional camera buffs but just like to take good pictures without too much trouble.  This camera has been just the ticket for us.  Have owned many Canon products and have yet to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Another Great Canon!
Reviews.Author: LuAnn
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my 60D! The photos are super sharp, the lighting excellent (and great even at high ISOs.). The video is hi-quality and very smooth (that is when I'm not moving it like crazy). I shoot professionally and bought this to replace my XSi. I already have a 50D. It only took me a few times on my 60D to get used to the controls being on the left (as opposed to the 50D which are on the right). Overall, I couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Exception Camera
Reviews.Author: AC
Reviews.Content: Pros:Seriously fast.  Excellent picture quality.  Well weighted, feels great in your hands.  Menus and user interface intuitive.Cons:Issue with built-in flash being permanently disabled after using an external flash. It doesn't matter if you remove the external flash or not, the built-in will not function.  This is a known issue and can be fixed by Canon.I upgraded from a Canon Rebel XTi to this camera.  The difference, obviously, is major.  I really wanted to move up to a 5D Mk II, however, the price just wasn't justifiable to me.  The 7D did not seem to have any additional features that I required so I made the decision on the 60D.I am absolutely satisfied with my purchase and would highly recommend this camera to just about anyone.  Beginners keep in mind there will be a learning curve associated with this camera, however, it isn't any more than any other product on the market.

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Joey Lovell
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can complain about is the plastic body. I would've really liked to see it with a magnesium body like the 50. Other than that its a beautiful camera. I use it primarily for filming, and for photo recreational use. I love the video on this camera. The swivel screen, as small a detail as it seems, is actually very useful. I didn't think how much of a difference it would make until I started to shoot narratives and documentaries with it. And the depth of field and the color on it is fantastic. For one of the cheaper DSLRs, it packs a really great punch.

Reviews.Title: Only one detail
Reviews.Author: Ian C.
Reviews.Content: Very nice pack (camara + 18-135mm Lenes) for starting in the semi pro techniques of photography. Very, very happy with this purchase! But only one detail, so far: the 18-135mm Canon Lens providen, does not has a "lock" button for transportation; that means, this semi-long zoom lens usually slips forward if you don't hold with your hand. The rest, excellent equipment, excellent brand!

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: steve m.
Reviews.Content: This camera has been everything i've expected and some. the tilt lcd screen comes handy especially while shooting video. The camera is a bit lighter then older canons and the trigger is a bit hesitant sometimes but minor things considering the great picture and video quality.

Reviews.Title: Winner!
Reviews.Author: P. Holt
Reviews.Content: This replaced my Canon Digital Rebel XT (which still hangs out but in the background).  Originally, I was torn between this and the T2i/T3i - boy am I happy I took the plunge.  Notably because more of the customizable settings are far more accessible with the top-mount LCD and controls.  With my old XT and the T2/3i, these settings are buried in menus.Having the fine-tuning controls such as AF and ISO so easily accessible opens many new doors.Not to mention, this camera takes great pictures.  If you're replacing an entry-level DSLR like I was, this is what you want (at minimum anyway!).  Go for it.

Reviews.Title: Best "Prosumer" Level DSLR
Reviews.Author: Joseph James Clemente "Apollo"
Reviews.Content: I owned a Canon EOS 10D for 8 years, put several hundred thousand exposures through it in all types of conditions...including a coworker dropping it 4 feet onto concrete...the lens broke the fall ;-). It finally gave up the ghost and I debated the 7 and 60Ds.  The few additional features and magnesium body of the 7D just didn't sell me on the extra $700.  Without cracking the manual, I began shooting.  Ok, the 18-135mm IS lens isn't L series quality but it is very good for a "toss in" starter lens.  I also have the 28-200 USM and the 100--400 L IS USM.  All three lenses are delivering photos my 10D could only dream of.The auto-focus is very quick on all 3 lenses and auto-focus assist comes on when it should.  While I use an external flash (Speedlight 420EX) for most situations the pop-up works great!  the 10D never got red-eye reduction right... With the 60D I've taken pics of blue-eyed kids and pets (notorious for red or glow eyes) in near dark conditions with nary a bit of red eye.The one accessory I consider mandatory is the BG-E9 battery grip.  Since Canon switched to an ABS body for the 60D (the ONLY negative I have) the grip adds a more substantial feel to the camera.  It also holds 2 batteries so you can shoot your memory card dry.  Having a grip on my 10D, and grip/winders on my 35mm SLRs I could never get used to a camera without one.  The upside of the camera body being ABS is that even with the grip, the whole rig is lighter than my 10D... a definite + when lugging it for 8 hours of airshow photography or a wedding.  The added battery life without swapping batteries in such situations is very convenient.I really haven't shot more than a few minutes of video but it was crystal clear.  I think if I were to use it as a video camera more often, I would get an external microphone.If you're new to DSLRs, it's a great starter package.  If you're upgrading from an older EOS x0D series Canon, you may miss the magnesium body but you will be very pleased with the 18MP and consider the 1080P video as a bonus.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade from an older Rebel
Reviews.Author: Frank Miles
Reviews.Content: When I decided to upgrade from my Rebel XSi I had to decide between the 7D and the 60D. After comparing the specs I couldn't justify the higher price for the 7D. Granted it has some great features -- higher burst rate, advanced AF system, focus microadjust -- but I decided I could live without those. I'm a hobbyist photographer with limited disposable income and so have to concentrate on getting the most bang for my buck.After shooting with the 60D I'm really happy with the results I'm getting with it. From an upgrader's perspective, here's what I gained over the Rebel:Better ergonomics. The 60D body is larger than the Rebel and feels better in my hands. Adding the Canon battery grip (I also had a battery grip on my Rebel) makes it feel even better.Autofocus is much improved over the Rebel, especially in low light.The viewfinder is bigger and brighter than the Rebel's.HIgh ISO performance is very good. I find that if I properly expose or slightly overexpose, I can get good results at 3200 and acceptable results at 6400. Noise is easily cleaned up in Lightroom. Pushing underexposed high ISO shots in post, unsurprisingly, yields really noisy images.The control and menu layout took some getting used to but I now like the Q screen and can adjust settings really quickly.The top LCD screen is handy for a quick look at camera settings.Burst rate is fast enough for me. I shoot RAW exclusively and so the buffer fills up quickly but I've yet to miss a shot because of this.The wireless flash triggering works great with my 580EX II and 430EX Speedlites and is a big improvement over fiddling with an E-TTL cord and a pair of Cactus V5 triggers for strobist-style shooting with the 2 flashes off-camera.The flip screen is more useful than I'd anticipated, particularly when shooting from a tripod in live view mode.I'd feared buyer's remorse after choosing the 60D over the 7D but that hasn't come to pass. The 60D is fun to shoot with and is serving my needs well. At some point in the distant future I'll probably upgrade to a full-frame body but think the 60D will do a fine job of keeping me happy until then.

Reviews.Title: Another great Canon
Reviews.Author: M. Carrico "Mark C"
Reviews.Content: The Canon 60D is my second DSLR that I have owned. The first one I bought early fall 2010. It also was a canon. I was so pleased with all of it's features, image quality and versitility. After just 2 weeks with this camera I have had great success with this camera. It took about this 2 weeks to really get use to the controlls. However, I have spent sometime with the 60D and I have only good things to say. The controlls are all very accessible and easy to use once it the 60D been studied and gotten use to. The multicontrol pad and dials function very well with no lag. This camera is a joy to use.  The digital screen on back makes taking video and photos at angles other than straight shots fun and exciting. The image quality is professional and very crisp.  The build quality, while not magnesium alloy, is of high quality and great for all day shooting.  I highly recommend it. I could have bought any camera except a hassel blaud 20K; the Canon 60D was the right choice for me and probably for may seeking a great DSLR that really fits and exceeds their needs and not their ego.

Reviews.Title: Powerhouse Camera
Reviews.Author: EB in DE
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR, although I have had excellent results for the past 3 years with the Canon G9.  I am only beginning to explore the potential of this camera, however, in my case coupled the the Canon EF-S 15-85MM lens, I am already producing pictures with amazing results.  First, the low light sensitivity of this camera is impressive.  In dark settings with minimal light the camera produces images with stunning clarity and color, more so than can be observed with the naked eye.  Second, the adjustable view finder is very handy when taking pictures at odd angles. Third, the video capabilities are also first rate with HD capture and excellent quality. The combination with the EF-S 15-85MM lens is an excellent starting point for a more advanced journey into digital photography.  Just make sure to buy a larger capacity SD card with class 6 or greater speed, this camera will capture and deliver megabytes at an astounding rate, especially in video mode.  A 4GB card will fill in 12 minutes at maximum quality settings.  Overall, I would highly recommend this camera to those interested in exploring photography in a greater capacity.

Reviews.Title: 60D is an excellent choice, over T2i/T3i
Reviews.Author: cperfection
Reviews.Content: I had been using the Canon XTI for years, but was ready to step up the capabilities, functions, and quality of my amateur photos.  I researched the Canon line, and found the 60D to be the number one choice.  This was over the T2i and T3i, as the Canon lenses fit all three bodies.  The overall focus ability is slightly better than the T2i and T3i, with the 60D delivering stunning in-focus (absent soft focus) results.  I've also had absolutely no issue with using the Transcend 16GB Class 10 mem card.  Very happy with the EOS 60D, 16GB mem card, and Amazon ordering/delivery of the products.  I highly recommend the combination.

Reviews.Title: Happy with upgrade
Reviews.Author: Gulf Shores
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Canon EOS XTi. The price made me hesitate as I am an artist, not a professional photographer, but winning a design prize helped me decide. It is heavier, but I have been making more video and use a sturdy tripod. One thing you can't do is change the focus while shooting video, but it is primarily a still camera. I like the way the LCD screen pivots so you can angle it to see what you are shooting in live mode.My lenses work with this camera with no problem. The shutter release is much smoother and faster than the XTi and taking multiple shots for some nature shots of osprey was smooth and fast. I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for the buck in the mid-level DSLR field!
Reviews.Author: James Gable
Reviews.Content: Choosing the perfect camera is certainly a difficult task. I was looking for a dslr in the $1000-1500 range, with an equal emphasis on still and video photography. After extensive research, I narrowed the choices to the new Canon T3i, the 60D, and the Nikon D7000. Since I plan on using the hd movie mode extensively, the articulating lcd screen (you don't know how great this option is until you actually use it!) was a huge selling point.  That effectively elimated the Nikon from consideration. Comparing the T3i and the 60D was easy...the 60D is hands down the better camera.  It has a better build, better AF system, faster burst rate, higher shutter speed, etc. And it's only $200 more than the T3i! I wound up buying the 60D with the 18-200mm Canon EF IS lens kit, for a grand total of $1399. The lens alone has an average street price of about $600, so the kit was an excellent value.Is this the perfect camera? No, but what camera is? There's always some feature you see on another camera that you wish was on yours. For example, I would love to have the dual SD card slots found on the D7000. But when deciding on the camera that best meets your needs, you have to weigh the pros and cons.  At least for myself, the 60D has far more pros than cons. It's a terrific camera, and an exceptional value at it's current price point. If you're looking for a mid level dslr, you would be remiss not to give this camera more than a passing glance.

Reviews.Title: Auto ISO and swivel screen best features for me
Reviews.Author: Popcorn 77
Reviews.Content: My last EOS camera was a 20D and have upgraded to the 60D. I have been looking at the 7D and 60D features and reviewed performances from DPREVIEW.com and also from the-digital-picture.com These 2 sites have detailed review notes and explains their process for doing their tests.The feature I liked most were the auto ISO and swivel screen. I  am aware that using the swivel screen (invoked by live view mode button) to focus is slow, but since i do not do sports shooting that much nor do I take pictures as a profession, I will use the live view mode when I want to see the image on a 3 inch screen rather than on the eye view finder. I am very happy with it, it allows me to shoot at body level.The next feature that I never had on my 20D is the auto IS0, I noticed on my indoor shots the ISO will be at 3200, even when I am at Aperture priority set at 2.8.  The picture quality is not that grainy. I noticed that with  the blu ray movies i have seen that the low light scenes are also grainy but it captures the mood of the available light. I like this feature because I will get the right exposure always without manually setting the ISO.I bought the 60D over the 7D because I was trying to use the savings to buy a better flash and a vertical grip and also a remote switch. I also forego the compact flash I already own in favor of the SDXC format since I only have 3 CF memory cards.Of course the 7D is more money because it is more durably built and has more features that I may not need on most occasions. Example would be the more added weather sealing, more cross points focusing, alloy body,  AF lense adjustment. For me this is minor, and same is tru for the mouse that I have grown familiar with.  I am not bothered with using the new mouse.With the 60D, I have the features I want and allow me to buy the vertical grip and upgraded flash and remote switch with the savings from not getting the 7D. Owning a DSLR is costly if one wants the best, and the 7D is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: Great Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: DRS
Reviews.Content: I was torn between this and a 7D as I wanted to shoot lots of video as well as photos and unless you're a professional photographer shooting everyday the 60D is a fantastic buy.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Gioia Napoli "bundy-papo"
Reviews.Content: It's my very first SLR - and at the beginning I was kind of concerned how to handle such a big and heavy camera. I bought it after several month of comparing similar items. Now I've taken some pictures with it - and it's great! The handling is easy, the pictures are great and I'm getting used to carry a big fotobag with me.

Reviews.Title: No complaints yet
Reviews.Author: L. Wong
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, so far no problems, the images look great (works well with my 'L' lenses), isn't that what its all about in the end. Its light enough to take everywhere yet feels great in the hand. This camera feels solid. As far as the plastic body goes, don't most laptop computers come with plastic bods and I think they are abused way more than a camera. The only specs I really cared about was having faster shutter speed and a higher ISO. I upgraded from a Rebel XT. I still don't understand why people need to always upgrade from one xxD to the newest one, it would save you a lot of money if you upgrade every 6 or 7 or even 10 years.

Reviews.Title: More camera than I could have dreamed of
Reviews.Author: E. Anderson
Reviews.Content: This camera is more than I could have ever dreamed.  I asked for a rebel and was gifted this and am finding it to be more camera than any mom could ever dream of.  I look forward to adding a lens or two down the road, but for now this lens is great for shooting a wide variety of activities.  The video is also great!  This camera will likely be the last camera we need to get through kids and even the after years!

Reviews.Title: My niece, who is an amazing and successful photograper recommended this for me!
Reviews.Author: Carol Klinefelter "C.A. KLINE"
Reviews.Content: Okay, I am a very proud aunt and when it came for me to buy a camera that would be good for a beginner, I called my niece.  She is a very amazing and successful photography owner of My 4 Hens Photography (yes I am a shamelessly proud Auntie). She told me that this was the first camera she used when she started.  I asked my niece about it and she recommended that I read the book (she said I may need to read it several times).  I did and I actually like to manually focus my pictures.  The only problem is that I don't use it enough so I lose what I learn.  I suggest if you are going to invest in a camera, this is beyond wonderful but you have to read the book that comes with it and don't be like me.  Use it and enjoy it!  It actually takes very professional pictures and if you are planning on starting a career or just using it for fun, I highly recommend this Canon EOS 60D!

Reviews.Title: AWESOMENESSIFICATIONALISM!!!!
Reviews.Author: Omar Brown
Reviews.Content: its a word. look it up. there's a pic of this camera by it. seriously. from HD video to VERY HD pics....this is all I will need until I become the super professional that I am destined to be.

Reviews.Title: The Total Package
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: 18.0 Megapixels5.3 frames-per-secondVari-angle 3.0 inch LCD screen100-6400 ISOWhat more could I ask for?I was issued this camera when I was working for my college newspaper and it did what I wanted it to and more. This camera is a big, huge step above the cameras I was issued in the past, the EOS 10D and Rebel XTiThe vari-angle screen was awesome and it came in handy for shooting various angles.Sporting events were a breeze, shooting at 5.3 frames per second made it easy to capture all the great moments. This camera is great and easy to use. The 100-6400 made it easy to shoot in low-light situations. Pictures were crisp, color was vibrant. Video quality was amazing.Love the settings and all the features. This camera helped me win awards at an annual intercollegiate press association in Texas.The Canon EOS 60D is literally the total package.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Lars Tarsim
Reviews.Content: Still on the cheaper, consumer-grade end of the spectrum, this is a wonderful camera. It has a bit of a pro-lookalike body. It has more features than the Rebel cameras, and the flip-out LCD is great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera - couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: GlitterBird
Reviews.Content: I'm upgrading from my Rebel XSI 450D to the new 60D.  Wow, what a difference!  The main thing that I've noticed is how much easier it is shooting in the manual setting.  Excellent shots right from the start.  Feels good in my hands, the shutter "click" is smooth, quiet, feels professional.  I can't tell a difference in the metal body vs the new body of the D60.  Feels the same to me. Solid camera.  I did not purchase the kit lens with this camera as I have L lenses that I use on a daily basis and didn't need to spend the extra money.  I'm still learning all the "ins and outs" on the camera but so far, wow, it's worth the money.  I hope the battery is as good as my XSI.  I've taken over 20K shots on my XSI in 2 years and the batteries are excellent, and keep a charge for what seems like forever!If you're looking to upgrade from your "workhorse rebel" but can't spring for the more expensive 7D, this is a good upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Toph
Reviews.Content: I own a few camera including Canons 5d MkIII, Canon T2i and two GoPro Blacks.  I use these all for action sport photography and video.  This camera is my favorite to shoot photos with during the day due to its quick FPS and the articulating screen.  The web is saturated with amazing reviews and detailed image and performance reviews so there is not much for me to say here.This camera has been in downpour rain a few times and has never made a hiccup.  I have a Delkin rubber case over the body and it adds extra protection against the elements and has kept this camera running when others gave up.  I have been looking at the 70d for a future purchase but until this guy gives up then there is no reason it is a work horse.  I have over 95,000 shutter actuations and it works as good as the day I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: My Baby
Reviews.Author: stephanie stone
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as my back-up camera and use it almost daily. As a professional photographer I need to be able to grab my gear and go when a situation presents itself. This camera is reliable, great on battery consumption, fits nicely in my hands, and is compatible with my  lenses.It can shoot HQ video as well as still images, and the menu interface is pretty intuitive.I would recommend this camera for any professional photographer (it shoots up to 18  mp), or any advanced amateur photographer.Too many bells and whistles for beginners, although you can use it in full auto mode if you like.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR
Reviews.Author: JOSHUA COOK
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR after using a sony DSCF717 and F828. I am absolutely happy with the choice. I recommend getting the body only and buying first the lenses that fit the subject you will shoot most often. This body is comfortable, durable, and the ergonomics of the buttons are nice.

Reviews.Title: I love my new Canon
Reviews.Author: Dafna Aravna
Reviews.Content: It's my first real camera. It's friendly and easy to use. It's a bit heavy though, and I guess I'll just need to get use to it.But the Pics are amazing :)

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Elaine I.
Reviews.Content: It takes beautiful pictures and amazing HD videos! The LCD rotates so it offers more flexibility in your shoots. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Canon 60D, Perfect?
Reviews.Author: d coulson
Reviews.Content: It may not be the latest or the lightest but it is very predictable and fairly easy to use and the pictures are great.  The video capabilities make it the perfect grandpa camera, perfect for me.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who really wants a high quality dslr at a price that has become much more reasonable in the last year.  I really like, love, whatever, this camera and it replaced the old Canon, EOS Rebel Digital, perfectly.  Perfect is a word that I find perfect when describing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS 60D body only
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I have had a Canon Digital Rebel for 9 yrs. and this camera (60D) is triple the MP we are used to.  So far Christmas pictures have been sharp clear and it is easy to use.  Have not tried the video yet but that is next experiment.

Reviews.Title: Thank you Canon and a BIG THANK YOU for Amazon!
Reviews.Author: Cris
Reviews.Content: Review for Canon: This camera is awesome. Works great in any conditions and generates high quality pictures. I had some bad luck with the first camera received from Amazon, which was defective .... and I'm wondering how's possible for such an expensive item to pass the Canon QC tests.Review for Amazon.com: I would like to say something here about Amazon.com because of my experience with the Customer Service Department. As I said above, the first camera was defective, so I requested a replacement. Amazon.com analyzed and solved my request VERY VERY fast and a new camera has been sent overnight. Here is where I would like to say a BIG THANK YOU to Amazon.com, because I made a mistake (so my fault 100%) and Amazon.com fixed the problem for me, again, even if it was my fault, telling me that the only goal for them is to make me happy.  Now... this is what I would name REAL CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!  This is why I give Amazon.com 6 (six) stars out of 5!!!  THANK YOU Amazon and please give a bonus to the Customer Service Reps.!

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera Canon EOS 60D
Reviews.Author: Michael Daly
Reviews.Content: My early Christmas Present to myself, and absolutely love it.  My favorite feature is the Articulating LED display screen.  I use this to shot action pictures of my daughter in all her activities, from Girl Scouts to Soccer game EOS t2i, and the 60D has the same DIGIC 4 image processor.  That was my biggest incentive for this Camera, that and it's durability.  My t2i is still going strong and is now my back up camera. ​

Reviews.Title: Black Friday Deal
Reviews.Author: Deborah S. Koch
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, I upgraded from a Rebel XS and wanted more features.  It takes some getting used to, but I'm finding lots of tutorials on YouTube.  HD video is excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Auto Focus is Very Fast
Reviews.Author: Jack W. Nelemans "Jacknel"
Reviews.Content: I went from a Rebel to this camera. A very good choice. I sold the lens and purchased an 18 - 200mm lens. This combination works very well for me. I also have a 400mm lens for birding and wildlife. I get some great shots on our travels.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Mughees Faiz
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera a lot. I was interested in photography but i already knew the basics. This made the 60D an ideal choice for me

Reviews.Title: the best item I have buy
Reviews.Author: Damon
Reviews.Content: As someone who has now had the opportunity to use all three of Canon's mid-range lineup (the T2i, 60D, and 7D), I have to say that I really like the feel of the 60D. Even though it no longer has the magnesium alloy body, it feels solid. In no way does it feel cheap. I have fairly small hands and the 60D feels like it was made for me. It's significantly lighter than the 7D and feels like it would be much more friendly on long hikes. The 7D feels much more robust; however, the 60D feels much more "comfy". It is definitely bigger in size than the T2i, but the angles and design of the camera have a nicely updated feel to them that makes it seem like you are getting a much more substantial camera. The articulating screen was also done very well. My initial worries that the screen would feel cheap and break easily were immediately relieved after using it. The hinges are very solid and feel almost stiff to the point where you are comfortable with it staying right where you want it. It also is very flush with the rest of the body and offers little space in between.

Reviews.Title: Better low-cost option than the 7D.
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected...took my photos to the next level.  Made the move from a T3 to the 60D, and I am very glad I chose the 60D.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera!
Reviews.Author: Larry L. Miller "Photographer"
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything it is suppose to do, and it is very easy to use.  I do mostly still photography, so I have not used the video mode very much.  However, what little video I have taken has been professional quality.

Reviews.Title: SO HAPPY!
Reviews.Author: Rhea
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING! I searched for months to find the right camera and found it and for the BEST PRICE OUT THERE! SO HAPPY!

Reviews.Title: good one
Reviews.Author: Hanchi Yang
Reviews.Content: With a long, very good. I bought a camera, I feel very good. Good quality, good price, it is recommended to buy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Hall
Reviews.Content: I blow most of my prints up to 20X30 prints, the clarity now at that size is stunning. Super clear.

Reviews.Title: Very good Camera
Reviews.Author: jwharding
Reviews.Content: Nice Camera It has wonderful low light sensitivity,  really long battery life, good quality 18-135 lens and better price than t5I ofSL1

Reviews.Title: My Dream Camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly Stum
Reviews.Content: I've wanted this camera from the first day it became available a few years ago.  Finally, I own it and it's like heaven - there is no comparison to my previous cameras (Rebels, AE1) and the ease of taking photos.  This camera makes an already-fun hobby the best that it can be.  It's easy to operate (I just spent a weekend playing around with it and browsing the menus) then bought a field guide to carry in my camera bag.  It's a dream!

Reviews.Title: Good Brand
Reviews.Author: Juan Velez
Reviews.Content: All my cameras systems are Canon. I start with Canon AE1 and continus using Canon: EOS Rebel T3 and now EOS 60D, also my zooms and lenses.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Jenny zhao
Reviews.Content: the camera is so nice!I am a new man in photography,and it picture quality is high.The depth of field is quiet cool!

Reviews.Title: A word about build quality
Reviews.Author: Mark Hanrahan
Reviews.Content: My wife bought me this camera to upgrade from my 400d/Rebel and it is definitely a significant step up.In general I'm very happy - the image quality is significantly better, it deals with low light situations much, much better and the sensor has enough power for you to crop in on a small section of a picture you've taken if you need to while not sacrificing too much image quality.While, overall I am very satisfied, I would caution that it has had to go in to have new battery controls and a circuit board replaced about 18 months after purchase - at almost a third of the cost of the camera. I take really good care of all my camera stuff - all my lenses etc live in their own little bags, but this, combined with the fact that my general-purpose EFS 17-85mm lens has required repairs twice in 3 years, makes me think that there is still something lacking in build quality.FWIW - I have several friends who only use Nikon, who have had similar trouble with more expensive models of that brand, so I don't think you'll get much better going elsewhere. It does seem kind of counter-intuiative that as I have upgraded my Canon equipment, it has become much more unreliable. My 400D/Rebel worked perfectly for 5 years, never required a single repair and was subjected to similar levels of punishment/care.Overall - for the price and image quality it is very good. Just bear in mind you will need to invest in quality lenses to get the most out of it, and the build quality is maybe not quite as good as you would want for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JimJ
Reviews.Content: It has exceeded my expectations especially the quality of the HD video.  I'm still learning how to get the best focus during videos because out=of-doors in the sunshine the screen is very hard to see well enough to change the focus.  I'm learning how to use AF in video mode and edit out the brief adjustments made by the lens.Photos are great in any mode I've chosen, so far.

Reviews.Title: Second Body, Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my second 60d [second shooter body] and I love this camera. It works well with all lighting conditions and the crispness of the image is supreme.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for pros and amateurs alike
Reviews.Author: MC
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a little over a year now and can say it's really a great camera whether you're a pro or an amateur.  What's important is that you get some good lenses for it and use it often enough to learn how to use it and stay proficient.  (There's so much to learn, and so much to forget!).  The 18-200 zoom lens in this kit has fast quiet focus, good image stabilization, and good image quality without too much chromatic aberration.This camera takes a great picture, and while I knew going in that it's a crop sensor, the ISO noise is worse than I was expecting.  It can be cleaned up in post-processing but still, even at ISO 400 in bright daylight there's more noise than there should be.  I really like the ability to remotely control an external flash by using the built-in flash, and the shutter can be triggered by either a plug-in or infrared remote (both found on Amazon cheap).This camera works with EF and EF-S lenses and has both a hot shoe and built-in flash.  Battery run time is very good and it comes with some good software for both controlling the camera from a laptop and processing RAW photo files.  Works with Magic Lantern aftermarket firmware for additional features.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality for a great price
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: Rotating screen is a nice feature. Colors and quality of photos is awesome.  Definitely recommend.  I use this on a professional level.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: cp
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera. I have a nice Canon I bought a few years ago and it looks like a toy compared to this one. I've only practiced for a few days but I love it so far.

Reviews.Title: Dreams and Opportunities
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Dave Kerr"
Reviews.Content: The flexibility that this camera has provided has allowed me to capture everything from model portraits to HDR landscapes - and beautifully! Is it for beginners? Sure, as long as the beginner uses the programmed settings. If the adventurous photographer wanders into the manual settings and the pictures aren't turning out as planned, chalk it up to a learning experience.In other words, this camera will not make anyone an artist but it does it's job extremely well. Canon has taken the simple concept of a light box and added a beefy CMOS panel, vibrant color processors and more. ...On a more personal note, I believe that a photo is never complete until it's been to the darkroom (aside from instamatics, it's always been that way - digital processing is no different).This technology provided me with the opportunity to take my photographic experience to the next level.I love shooting with the 60D and I recommend this camera to pro-amateurs and pro-hopefuls.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple years now and I still love it. It has held up so well and has great quality pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: A wonderful upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Herbert Kuehnemann
Reviews.Content: The 60D fills a niche between my prior Digital Rebel and the 7D. I very much like the lighter body and comfortable larger grip for my XL hands. Having the 1080 HD capability makes this a hybrid for an enthusiast like me that makes photography a lot of fun. The logic board gives me a range and depth of saturation of colors not possible in my older Rebel. I am very pleased with the results.

Reviews.Title: Canon 60D
Reviews.Author: mark omohundro
Reviews.Content: I've been using a Canon T2i for the past year or so to shoot mostly video. This is a great step up from the Rebel series. The body is much larger and just feels more natural in your hand.I would highly recommend this camera to anyone shooting photo or video on a affordable professional level.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR for Action Sports: Now I can show the internet how awesome I am!
Reviews.Author: Personal Penguin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily for shooting YouTube videos of tricking and parkour.  After years of salivating over DSLRs, and reading dozens of reviews, and trying to understand the technical specs, I chose the 60D for several reasons.1) Price.  It is affordable, and becoming more so.  As I write this review, it's dropped ~$70 since I bought it a couple weeks ago.  I'm still happy with my purchase.  Not only is the 60D a good value, but the EF lenses that cropped-sensor DSLRs use are also generally more affordable than their full-frame counterparts.2) Durability.  The "build quality" of the 60D is what separates it from the T3i and other Rebel models, for me.  This was truly the selling point.  There is less plastic and more metal on this camera.  Deathklok would be proud.  I know that I'm going to take this on cross-country flights, road trips, hiking trips, beach adventures, and more.  It's not bullet proof, but a little extra resistance to moisture and the elements is worth it for how I'm going to use it.3) Versatility.  I'm going to use this camera to make YouTube videos to share my progress in my sport, and to promote my gym.  The fact that it's a high quality camera means I can also use it for snapshots of friends, marketing photos for the website, action shots of events at the gym, head shots of my employees, etc.  Using different lenses I can get into all kinds of fun stuff: wildlife photography, macro photography, perhaps even astrophotography (though the 60Da is better for that).  I can add microphones, separate flashes, mount it on a Glidecam, or a tripod, etc.  It is upgradeable and useful in a variety of situations.4) It's an "industry standard."  After talking to a lot of people who make awesome parkour and tricking videos, Canon DSLRs in general are the cameras of choice.  If you're looking for a camera for wedding photography, vacation photos, or whatever else, ask people who do that what camera they like.  Fifty million Elvis fans can't be wrong.  If they're all using Nikons, and have good reasons why, then get a Nikon, or a Pentax, or whatever.Okay, that said, I have only been using it for a few weeks.  It is definitely going to take me awhile to learn how to use this camera to it's fullest.  I have however taken a few pictures and videos already that I am very happy with.  The resolution is clear, the autofocus in photo mode is great, and the controls are easy to use once I have learned them.  I am pretty much a noob, so if I can do it, you can do it.In summation:1) Get this camera2) Do backflips3) PROFIT!

Reviews.Title: Just getting started
Reviews.Author: Joseph J. Deal
Reviews.Content: I am getting back into Photography and decided to go with the Canon EOS 60D. This camera is excellent. Starting out in fully programmed mode, it takes great pictures with no effort at all. Starting to experiment with Aperture Priority and Manual mode is more challenging because the range of options can be a bit overwhelming. I am looking forward to learning how to handle all of the options that tis camera offers and I am sure it will do everything that I want.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Anthony Anderson
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad camera it takes great photos and videos i have had this camera for 11 months now but now it will not power on and the Battery indicator just flashes good thing it is still within warranty so im sending it back to canon for repair but other than that its a nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera.
Reviews.Author: Lawrence W. Becker
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my new Canon EOS 60D.  I had planned on buying a comparable Nikon - I have owned a few Nikons - but read reviews that indicated problems that led to grease on the mirror.  So far, I love the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Danielle Alamares
Reviews.Content: Been thinking whether to get 7D or this. Made the right choice, would rather spend the remaining $$ to buy lens. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a nice DSLR video.

Reviews.Title: simply nice
Reviews.Author: Isaac M. Carter "Isaac"
Reviews.Content: upgraded to this cam from a canon rebel & the differences are phenomenal, loving the cameras 18 mp it's a great upgrade from some of the entry level slr's out there and still not gonna break the budget.

Reviews.Title: Everything that I expected
Reviews.Author: Yoshi
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I was using a Canon Rebel XSi and was looking to get something a little more professional that fit my needs. I read plenty of reviews so I knew what I was getting and it was amazing. It feels so much better in my hands, its a little bit larger and feels more robust. The fps rate is more than I need and I suggest buying a good memory card to keep up with it. I do portrait and wedding photography as a side-job and this pretty much fit the bill within my budget. I do plan on keeping this after I upgrade again to a bigger and better body but for now, this is perfect. Definitely worth the money. The lowlight performance alone is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Audra Lofrano White
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an upgrade to my Rebel xs. What a HUGE difference. I compared this with the 7D and, for the money, the 60D is as good or better. Read the manual and buy a book that will walk you through the settings.

Reviews.Title: :) one happy camper
Reviews.Author: Migtwitz
Reviews.Content: I used to be a nikon guy, now i shoot canon, and i got this as a back up for my 5d mark iii, and let me tell you , i enjoy this little camera more than the 5d, it just goes back to the basics! everything it's at your finger tips! i am not so sure about the screen that moves... it feels like it can get damage quickly, but overall great camera!

Reviews.Title: A great step up from the canon Rebel series
Reviews.Author: Bruce Olsen "Norsk_Ole"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my Rebel T1 (500).  I like the new features and there are so many of them.  However, Canon did well to reduce the complexity of photography with the extra dials and buttons in the back.  I do not consider my self a novice and I barely make a good hobbiest which is something I want to become.The camera takes awesome pictures and I really like how the video works.  My rebel had the video feature but I rarely used it and with this camera it may be one of the most used features because of how much easier it is to use.I was reluctant to spend the extra money for the 6/7d and I wanted something more the rebel series.  This was a good fit.  I did my research on the internet prior to buying to help ensure I bought the right camera for my needs

Reviews.Title: Fun with pictures
Reviews.Author: Bear
Reviews.Content: My son being a film major in college loves this camera. He had used one similar in school and found it to be easy and fun. The pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: I am a newborn when it comes to the world of DSLRs.  Until I get my feet wet, dirty, whatever this camera and kit lens has allowed me to take some great pictures with very little knowledge base.

Reviews.Title: Canon Love
Reviews.Author: coleallensmom
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to the 60D from a Canon XTi. I loved my Xti, but the 60D is the perfect upgrade. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS 60D
Reviews.Author: Mellissa Hilbers
Reviews.Content: I took the plunge and moved up in the Canon lines. I started like so many with one of their Rebel series and finally upgraded to a more pro-style body. I chose the 60D because of the price difference between it and the 7D. It's not near has heavy and since I do nature most of the time it is easier for me to handle than the extra weight I would get from the 7. The 60D produces sharp, precise shots and is a pleasure to work with. Granted there is quite the learning curve between my old Rebel (which is also a great camera), and the 60D, but nothing a person can't overcome and conquer.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: B. LEARY
Reviews.Content: I take thousands of photos  a year for a high school newspaper and yearbook. This camera does everything. It can go to 3200 ISO, take sports or portraits in low light (night football, anyone?), has more setting than I will ever use, and will even take video. If you want to take video, however, make sure you have a fast sd card (8 or more).  It's a little smaller and lighter than the 50D, which is a workhorse still camera only, but most people will prefer the versatility of this.

Reviews.Title: My new Canon 60D
Reviews.Author: Brian R. Hurley "Indy constructor"
Reviews.Content: I have a decent sized wedding photography business. For the past few years I have used 10D bodies and they have been reliable, practical and made plenty of couples very happy with my work. Due to age and practicality I finally decided that the large 3" screen, higher resolution etc, I decided to retire the 10Ds and buy 60Ds. I used them on my last and found them to be a great purchase, I used the battery grips and found them excellent in every area. The video is not a must but everything else is excellent, go buy one and see.

Reviews.Title: This Camera Is A Dream.
Reviews.Author: Mr. Beaty
Reviews.Content: 60D body is sturdy and has some weight to it which is nice for shooting handheld video.  Can't beat the moveable LCD screen.  Package deal with the Standard Zoom Lens is great for beginner videographers/photographers.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for all users/Rebel XT up-graders
Reviews.Author: MJB
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a professional photographer, but for the last 10 years it is one of my main hobbies.  I am also a video/audio production student and this camera delivers on the video front with more manual exposure control for audio in video than the 7D currently does.  The articulating screen is also highly advantageous if you are shooting in complicated positions.  (Stairwells, worm's eye-views, etc.)  Although the 60D is a bit slower on the draw than the 7D, (the 7D has dual processing cores for faster time between shots and slightly better low light processing.) unless your shooting extremely fast objects the 60D works great for the enthusiast or professional-the photos are variably the same with both.  The 7D was also heavier than the 60D.  DSLR's are already a bigger camera and I didn't want the added weight while shooting for extended periods handheld.  It's Polycarbonate body isn't weather sealed like the 7D's (magnesium body?) but it is lighter.  I came from using a Rebel XT several years ago and I still use it from time to time, but the 60D is by far a well-defined upgrade for the enthusiast who doesn't need the speed of the 7D.

Reviews.Title: Great mid-grade choice
Reviews.Author: Arron R. Howard "Nameless 1"
Reviews.Content: When I was looking to upgrade my DSLR camera, I wanted something I could grow with, as well as not breaking the bank. I have absolutely no desire to photograph as an occupation, as I am already operating a mobile DJ service, but I also want to be more creative with my photos, than the standard point and shoot. I already own another brand DSLR, but it is lacking the one function that I really wanted, which is to shoot video to promote my business, and I am an avid admirer of Canon products. I literally fought with myself on which model to buy, the Rebel T4i was in a close running, but the advanced features of the 60D edged the Rebel to the point to there was no real comparison.This camera is quite easy to navigate, once you've acclimated to it, and the features offer a ton of room to grow as a photographer, I haven't put this thing down for long, since I got it.Great prosumer (term used by my instructor) unit, I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera for the price... but...
Reviews.Author: Lkdd
Reviews.Content: The lcd mobility is ankward, and sometimes feels fragile... for the rest, this cam is amazing, good body feel, and buttons are good distributed, i miss the 7D rec button on the right of viewfinder...

Reviews.Title: Stunning except for some focusing issues
Reviews.Author: Gunerz1
Reviews.Content: This Camera is absolutely stunning for the quality it delivers at the price point. it has some focusing issues when in the live mode which can be irritating. except for that complaint it works like a charm. the controls are easy and well placed. the video mode works well  with limitations. Noticed aliasing but then 5D Mark II had the same complaint.Get this Camera and Shoot like a dream.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bruce
Reviews.Content: I came from Canon point & shoot to this 60D.  I loved everything about this camera and I shoot 50/50 still and video as my hobby.  With Magic Lantern installed this camera is a lot more powerful. You can shoot like a Pro if your put your passion into it.

Reviews.Title: My first real camera
Reviews.Author: Casa_Hernandez
Reviews.Content: This was my Christmas gift, and I have to say I couldnt be happier. I am in no way shape or form so I hope this does not sound to bad, but I have this new idea to talk about the things I use and like.The Canon 60D feels right, its weight, its grip, I like the view window, its easy to navigate and takes great images. If you like to have something that lasts, this camera feels solid, and I guess that is what makes it so great, it feels like a camera... and expensive camera at that should feel like.If you are in the market for a great camera with great results, I recommend the Canon 60D

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS 60D
Reviews.Author: C_lee
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I would highly recommend it.  It is extremely versatile and will appeal to anyone from semi-pro to the novice photographer.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera, but...the lens.
Reviews.Author: Likes Amazon
Reviews.Content: Takes very good photos and easy to use. Video quality is very good. One issue is the lens rotation/zoom feels too loose. Wish it had more friction so it would feel more solid and not rotate so easily. Other then that I love the Canon 60D.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: PaulMedik
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera / lens kit for just over two months now and can't imagine how I went so long without it.The Canon 60D has opened a new world of photography for me even though for years I've taken over 5000 pictures, I now take a lot better pictures!  The 60D has all the features of the hobby DSLRs plus the pro features that lets you grow as a photographer.  It took a while for me to decide on the 60D, but I am very happy that I made the decision.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Brown "skipperbrown"
Reviews.Content: I have taken about 5000 images with this camera over the last 12 months and I keep saying 'wow'.  For a photography serious amateur, this is a very fine choice.

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera and I am very happy one year in.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Cargill
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera about a year ago.  My only other experience was with an older Canon Rebel, which was nice but the 60D is definitely a step up.  The battery lasts a long time compared with older Canons, which was especially nice when I took it to Europe last summer, because I could shoot all day without exhausting the battery, which surprised me.  Another upgrade I enjoy is the ability to shoot RAW plus jpg for each shot, which can be practical in a variety of ways, like when you shoot a model and want to send some quick jpgs, or when you shoot some serious travel photos but want the accessibility of jpg to post fresh pics to Facebook, flickr et al.  Very lightweight body also.The reticulating screen is a great idea if just for the fact you can keep the preview screen folded in all or most of the time to protect it from dirt, scratches and breakage.  I have found, however, that the reticulating screen is difficult to focus with; it just does not seem to want to lock the focus.  I was trained in film, and I used a Rollei for a while, so I thought of doing ant's eye shots with it and other odd angles.  Maybe I just need to mess with the settings.Highly recommended for the serious film guy who makes the jump to digital.BTW, yes I still use film.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - awesome lens!
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the lens on this camera - and the IS capability.  Several people told me I could not get a great water shot that showed movement (setting shutter speed really low) without using a tripod.  Well they were wrong.  I was able to get some incredible shots.  The picture was in focus except the water was nice and soft showing the movement. I don't know how to attach a photo or I would.

Reviews.Title: A great buy
Reviews.Author: C. Arndt
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a quality camera that could last me quite a while and even bring me into some professional photography situations and this camera definitely fit the bill.  I have had this camera for over a month now and am loving it more every day.  The settings and diversity of this camera are amazing, the starting lens has wonderful functionality, and the audio and video that this camera has are of a superb caliber even though I did not expect it.  Overall this camera is everything and more I was hoping for, so I recommend it fully for a begging or intermediate photographer that is looking to expand and learn more.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Mid-Range Camera!
Reviews.Author: buzz
Reviews.Content: Im so happy with this camera. This is my first DSLR. I did'nt want to get a "Rebel" because it seems like most people "outgrow" theirs. Also did'nt want to overbuy getting a pro camera like the 7d. The 60d is a nice sweet spot for me. Awesome ergonomics, a nice articulating screen for self portraits and great fps.Just an overall great nice camera! Only bad thing is the articulating screen auto focus is slow- so its better for non moving objects.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Photography tool
Reviews.Author: Pianoman
Reviews.Content: As a university photography teacher I can say that this is one of the best values for a semi-professional photographer.  While I am the first to realize that true photography takes place in the mind of the photographer, this camera has the stuff to assist in many ways.  The pivot view-screen, wireless flash triggering, top information display, and 3 stop auto bracketing (for HDR)  all add to the ability of this camera to compete with any other brand or price range.  I purchased this through Amazon.com and was completely satisfied with the order.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Worth Every Penny
Reviews.Author: Eric Goranson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera 5+ months ago and have absolutely loved it.  I was tempted to get the T2i but was talked into the 60D by a friend.  I'm so glad I went with the 60D.  Even with the new T3i out now, I would stick spend the extra on the 60D.  The solid feel, relatively easy menus, the LCD screen, and crystal clear photos are awesome.  If money were no object, I'd have purchased a full crop sensor instead but as long as I keep the crop sensor in mind when choosing which lens to use, I always come home with great photos.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, OK lens
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "RegularGuyAtMissouri"
Reviews.Content: Camera is really good. I am not a professional, so I don't see myself upgrading the camera for another 10 years (ofcourse its an exaggeration, but its really good :) ). Images are really good, High iso images are far better than my previous XSI. I see 3200 very much acceptable. ISO 6400 is grainy like film in lowlight, but it is also usable unless you are planning to blow it up. Havent tested video exhaustively. But the ones i have done till now is reasonably good too !Lens is really a regular walkaround lens. Get a few good lenses if you really like to see value of the money you spent on this camera. I cant buy a canon 70-200mm f2.8, so I also bought the Tamron 70-200 F2.8 since I am on a budget.My wish list for the Lenses with this camera.- Tokina 11-16mm F2.8- Canon 70-200 F2.8 IS USM- Tamron 28-75 F2.8- Canon EF 50mm F1.4

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Indie Film Lover
Reviews.Content: If you can't afford the 7D buy this camera. It's simply excellent. Only complaint is that it doesn't output hdmi to 1080. The 7D does.

Reviews.Title: 1,265$ burned within an hour!
Reviews.Author: Joseph H.
Reviews.Content: This is a late review I've been busy with college and other things. Anyways here is my review.ITEM:I purchase this camera a month and two weeks ago. I burned about 1,265$ for this DSLR camera. I THINK IT'S WONDERFUL (no sarcasm intended)!! I was so excited after un-boxing this package. The DSLR comes in with an audio function, which I can adjust the audio if it's too loud, and increase or decrease the sensitivity of the audio. I think the Canon 60D is the only DSLR camera (that I know of) with audio function adjustment. Hence this is why it's great for filming. It's good for photography, and enthusiast young filmmakers (like me). It's a little pricey, but hey, I voluntarily purchase this camera at my own free will, which I received this benefit in return. Both sellers and buyers (Canon Company, and I) earned wealth. In other words, we're both happy of this trade. I give this DSLR camera a 5 star overall.LENS: 5 stars on the 18-135mm lens. The lens came with the package because I did not ordered the DSLR body camera by itself. It wouldn't be great without a standard lens. It's great for beginners, and pretty big at first sight.Battery Performance:The battery performance last pretty long. Of course, when the battery arrives in the package it always needs a full charge. Don't expect it's going to be fully charge for you (just like any other kind of new a cell phone. Suppliers/Sellers don't have the time to charge your battery if they are selling their product). I would forget to turn off the camera for a few days and the battery still last really long (It's at a full battery power) probably because it can conserve in standby mode.Construction Quality & Controls: 5 stars for the construction and controls, not too difficult at all. The camera fits perfectly right in your hands as you firmly grip it. Comparing to my brother's DSLR Canon 600D(T3i), the 600D is slightly smaller than this 60D. The construction is bigger, almost as big as the Canon 7D from looking at the online reviews. What is different are the controls, buttons, and settings. It is different from any other kind of Canon DSLR cameras(It doesn't surprise me). It's pretty straight forward, if you don't understand or think the buttons and controls are overwhelming. Then read the manual that is what it's there for.Image Quality: I am not going to give the image quality a rating because taking photos and collecting footage are all base on YOU. You need to alter and adjust the settings. You can't just give the quality ratings by default. It's how you can change the image quality through the settings. You can color correct it through this Canon 60D, saturation, increase or decrease the ISO levels, landscape, portrait, in doors, out doors, etc. and other color correcting settings. I can't give my opinions on this. I would if I were to compare this to a different DSLR camera like Sony, Nikon, and etc. Other than that all the images are sharp when you focus with your lens (FYI, there are plenty of lens you can buy), or you can adjust the colors and sharpness through the settings.Other thoughts,I was going to purchase this DSLR camera on Newegg.com, however, when I was browsing online it was out-of-stock for two whole weeks. I had to buy one somewhere besides going to Best-buys or Fry's N Electronics. Luckily, Amazon only had 8 in-stocks left when I checked before I purchased one. This was the quickest option I did before it gets out of stock. When the package came in the box itself was slightly ripped. I was a bit afraid it could've been damage, however, it wasn't damaged at all Amazon got me a bit worried with the shipment hahahaha. It's an easy DSLR camera, great for beginners especially for young, new, intermediate filmmakers. This is a good camera for great investment. I'm sure I'll keep this for a very long time before I move on to a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Much to love about this camera...
Reviews.Author: black gorilla "book lover extraordinaire"
Reviews.Content: Let me start out saying I love this camera. The only reason I marked 2 areas with only 3 stars is because I had to base it on the lens that came with the camera, the kit lens. It isn't the greatest, but it's sufficient to work with while learning the 1,000 and 1 things this camera can do. (I have now purchased 2 other lens, a zoom and a macro and the pictures with them are simply great!)There are complaints out there that the camera is plastic. Piffle! It's solid as a rock. Anything they can do to minimize weight is fine with me. I have arthritis in my hands and the heavier the camera, the harder it is. I like the camera weight. The lens, of course, are heavier, so the lighter camera works good.When I first started taking pictures, I was disappointed. But, it also takes knowing how to combine the shutter speed, the f-stop and the ISO to get a quality picture. This isn't a camera you take out of the box and it works first time. If you want that, get yourself a Canon Powershot SX30 IS, which is what I had before. I love that camera still (versatile, lightweight and wonderful for quick shots). Super zoom, which I really liked.Rather than print out the manual for the 60D, which I can never understand anyway, I spent the extra money and bought the Dummies book for this camera. I took it on vacation, read and studied it and when I got home and the camera was sitting on the kitchen table waiting for me, I was already well versed in a lot of things. I still refer to it whenever I hear or read something I don't understand. It's a fantastic book and well worth the money.I had to buy a sturdier tripod and a larger camera bag to go along with the camera, too. But, it's money well spent. I would like to be able to take pictures without the tripod and I'm working hard to build up strength. It's clumsy to carry the tripod around, but I take a lot of shots where it works great and I'm pleased to have it.I am surprised at the length of the battery life. I keep checking to see if it's about to run out and it just seems to last a lot longer than I thought it would. I use the live view function a lot and that's supposed to shorten battery life, but I haven't noticed it.I haven't mentioned video because that is something that doesn't interest me.At the moment I'm chronicaling the life span of three black swallowtail caterpillars on the fennel in the front yard. When I took the first pictures 2 days ago, they were 3/8 of an inch long. Yesterday they were half an inch. I'm getting great pictures of those exceedingly tiny creatures with my macro lens.I've taken great bird pictures, blue jay, woodpecker, cardinals and squirrels getting into the feeder(!) and of course my flowers. I've joined our local camera club and I read lots of photographyI would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Investment
Reviews.Author: cobramustang8133
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few months now so I can now properly write a review.  First of all let me say I am just an amatuer photgrapher. I upgraded from a Rebel XTi.
